content:
Would it be right to say that Prop, Type 0, Type 1, Type 2 are nothing but syntax sugar/alternative names for, respectively, Sort 0, Sort 1, Sort 2, Sort 3?

When we say "a particular universe" - do we always refer to a particular Sort #n? That is, Sort 0, Sort 1, Sort 2,..., Type 0, Type 1, Type 2,..., Prop are all particular universes (some of them equivalent to each other), and there are no other universes in Lean?
image.png
Evgenia Karunus has marked this topic as resolved.
